attributes.action: introduce legislation to change the law so that anyone who is in this country illegally CANNOT invoke protection under the Human Rights Act and use that to prevent deportation back to the country of origin.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Illegal means 'it did not happen within the law' therefore anybody who is here 'illegally' is 'not covered by our laws' and therefore is not entitled to be protected by any Human Rights or other legislations which apply to people who are legally 'here'. Other EU member countries deport illegals, how come they can do it within the law and this country cannot?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
